poem:
Title: Unfallen Snow's Fallacy

(A ski-trip to nothing:laughter's vanishing act,
fumbling with trails not
Undressed in their winter cloak;
black sorrow's unwanted coat,
bequeathed by the
sly sun- a lukewarm, indifferent beast.
the white dreams of skiers,
widely outspread,now unfold,lost
as the morning glimmer twitches its last breathe,
The quiet desolation of untouched snow;
a vanishing act,
from life to shadow,
in this our,unending ecological theatre).
prompt: You are the poet E.E. Cummings. You woke up this morning feeling dreamy. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ski resorts battle for a future as snow declines in climate crisis After promising early dumps of snow in some areas of Europe this autumn, the pattern of recent years resumed and rain and sleet took over. In the ski resorts of Morzine and Les Gets in the French Alps, the heavy rainfall meant that full opening of resorts was delayed until two days before Christmas, leaving the industry and the millions of tourists planning". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
